features: Concentrated detergent formula is effective yet gentle on clothes
Contains plant-derived cleaning agents with dirt, stain-fighting enzymes, and other thoughtfully chosen ingredients
Biodegradable formula, HE laundry detergent for use in high efficiency and conventional washing machines
Garden-inspired Lavender scented laundry soap with an original and clean floral fragrance
Mrs. Meyer's products are made with cruelty-free formulas and are Leaping Bunny certified
body.description: Mrs. Meyer's Clean Day HE laundry detergent features hardworking yet gentle cleaning agents, while also providing a special, singular scent for your home. Our Lavender scented laundry detergent has long been prized for its original and clean floral scent. Such a pretty and reassuring herb! Effective yet gentle on clothes, our concentrated laundry soap really packs a punch when it comes to removing dirt and grime. Contains surfactants from plant-derived sources, dirt and stain-fighting enzymes, essential oils, other thoughtfully chosen ingredients and, of course, are always made with a cruelty-free formula. This biodegradable formula liquid detergent is HE compatible. Concentrated for 64 loads of laundry. Also available in other garden-inspired scents and products such as body lotions, liquid hand soaps, candles, and so much more! Mrs. Meyer's - Rooted in Goodness.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Making The World a More Greener Place One Garden At A Time Mrs. Meyer’s Clean Day products are inspired by the garden, which is why we’re inspired to plant flowers, plants and trees. At Mrs. Meyer’s, we have a passion for the environment. We also know the importance of being a good neighbor in our home, our community and our world. That’s why we’ve made a commitment to improving the earth one flower, plant and tree at a time through our campaigns, partnerships, volunteering efforts and donations.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing !!! I will but it all the time now
reviews.reviewText: That’s the best organic laundry product .Smell very good the lavender like lavender .It cleans very well even on fast laundry and cold . And your clothes smell good and are super clean . And it’s completely organic and very good price . You won’t but other laundry detergent if you try this one . It’s the best !!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's the Scent of the Stuff for Me
reviews.reviewText: This gets my clothes clean and smells amazing! The other day, I washed the shower curtain and liner from my husband's shower. When I hung them back up, the smell of the detergent made the whole bathroom smell so good. I literally kept walking in there and putting my nose in the shower curtain.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Everything comes out, smelling nicely after using this laundry detergent.
reviews.reviewText: are use this laundry detergent with a bit of baking soda and borax. I put it in hot water in a bucket with those two other cleaners and let heavily soiled clothing soak. It strips the sweat and grease out of practically anything that has spots. Then I use a bit of this in my laundry machine and wash with it. Not only does the clothing come out sparkling, clean without the sweat, but it comes out, smelling nice.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very good laundry detergent.
reviews.reviewText: Smells good. Works very well. Even on dog blankets and couch covers. I will purchase again. Works amazing for people who have hard water. It even brought back the bright colors in my dresses.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Very surprised at how little you use & clothes come clean & smell fresh

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars depends on how bad you stink
reviews.reviewText: It’s so hard to do anything when you have nothing to do. I always put my tasks away for later when they don’t have a specified deadline. I promise myself that when another wave of downtime rolls in at work, I’ll be productive. Catch up on the news, complete some online tutorial, get into self-learning, write a book, learn how to play chess, SOMETHING. But instead, I just sink deeper into sloth. Sit around watching YouTube videos of cats or scroll Zillow pretending like I’m buying a house, increasing my budget with every minute, eventually browsing penthouses on Central Park South. I get wrapped up to the point that when someone asks me to do anything at all I feel bothered, infringed upon, get grouchy and offended.That’s exactly how the week I realized Mrs. Meyer's Liquid Laundry Detergent doesn’t quite cut the ice was. Pure, unadulterated sloth. The truth is that I did have a project to work on, but it was open ended. “Get it done in the next month or two,” they told me, which meant it wasn’t getting started on until I felt the pressure of time running out.Where the hell would the world be without deadlines?Anyways, I decided to take a nap. We have a quiet room at my job. Not to feel any lazier than I already did, I framed the nap as working on the optimization of my internal rest levels, which in turn would increase my overall work performance. It actually made me feel productive for the few seconds that I believed it. I stretched out on the huge recliner and dreamt about my cat.I sat up and looked at my phone. Thirty-seven minutes passed. Good deal, good nap. I went to get up and noticed that something stinks like an old dish rag. I started sniffing around – was it the recliner? Did someone spill something in here? Was it…It was me. I sniffed my t-shirt. It was me! I was appalled. I felt violated. How could this be? I mean, I JUST did the laundry. This t-shirt is fresh out of the closet. “Maybe you took it out of the laundry bin,” I heard a voice saying in my head. Nothing made sense. I started getting dizzy.I saw no other choice. I had to get home and change. The last thing I need was my coworkers getting offended by my smell. Normally this wouldn’t take longer than 30 minutes but I was attacked by homeless people on the subway on my way home so that added an extra 15minutes on top to fight them off. But anyways, after that I stunk ten times as bad.I ran into my apartment and started falling all over the place because I was rushing, trying to change my clothes. My cat got all nervous and started hissing at me, clawed at my leg a couple times then ran off somewhere. Things just don’t work when you try to rush.After I got back to work I realized that the clothes I changed into were washed with the same detergent and also stink. I guess it could have been worse though.Long story short, Mrs. Meyer's isn’t bad if you’ve got a brand-new state-ot-the-art washing machine with a million gallon drum and five-hour-long cycles and you don’t mix your gym clothes with your regular clothes, none of which is the case for me. So if you're just trying make it through life one day at a time without any extra hassles like I am, go on and get yourself some OxiClean and take smelly clothes off the list of things to worry about.

reviews.reviewText: Love that this item has a decent EWG score! The product is easy to use, has a mild scent, and is effective.

reviews.reviewText: We’ve been using Myers for years from hand wash to laundry. It doesn’t leave a lasting smell on your hands. Truly a good product.
